BrightHaven is a 501(c)(3) animal welfare organization providing rescue, hospice and holistic education, with an emphasis on senior, disabled and chronically ill animals. We are committed to giving animals the gift of tomorrow.

recommendations: January 12, 2017, Gail was a client of Carol’s

Carol’s ability to weave a compelling, cohesive story with her inventiveness and adept organization of concepts is a tremendous asset to our education program. She has worked on various BrightHaven projects over the last few years and I am delighted to recommend her for an amazing myriad of skills as well as the consistent excellence in the quality of her work. Her writing and project management skills are superb. Carol is easy to work with, creative and collaborative. I simply cannot speak highly enough of her talents.

September 26, 2013, Gail was a client of Mandy’s

Engaging Mandy's services was the most wonderful decision for BrightHaven. In a very short time she has implemented major changes of rebranding, board formation and reorganization of daily life via her HR experience. I cannot recommend Mandy highly enough for her experience, creativity and dedication to achieving only the best results.

summary: BrightHaven is a nonprofit organization with three aspects designed to serve animals most in need: —BrightHaven Rescue saves senior and special-needs animals from being euthanized in shelters through a program of rescue, rehab and placement in loving homes. —BrightHaven Sanctuary/Hospice provides a lifetime loving home and top-notch care to primarily senior, disabled and chronically ill animals, enhancing their lives and wellbeing.—BrightHaven Education shares information with the community arising from the extraordinary results seen when the balance of natural feeding, holistic care and modern medicine is used in a loving family environment.If you would like to donate, volunteer and/or learn more about BrightHaven's work,  please visit our website at www.brighthaven.org to learn more.
